ygData.subject: Re: How to stop spam/hate/annoying emails that are private forever!
ygData.msgSnippet: CAN WE PLEASE STOP THIS DAMN THREAD ALREADY ... From: David Edwards  To:  Sent: Thursday, August 05, 1999 8:32 AM
ygData.messageBody:
CAN WE PLEASE STOP THIS DAMN THREAD ALREADY


----- Original Message -----
From: David Edwards <Sun1@...>
To: <EQCheats@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, August 05, 1999 8:32 AM
Subject: Re: [EQCheats] How to stop spam/hate/annoying emails that are
private forever!


> From: "David Edwards" <Sun1@...>
>
> This whole topic has made me sick. But I have to put my 2 coppers worth
in
> now.
>
> Your Lawyer obviously doesn't know squat about electronic mail, laws
against
> spaming or anything else to do with the internet.
>
> In order for any contract to be "Binding" it must be signed or witnessed.
> If there was a way to send a registered E-mail, that showed the letter had
> been read by the correct recipient then yes Nick you could file a
harassment
> suit. As it is your suit or claim to suit is little more than pathetic
> attempt to bully a person on the list.
>
> Secondly, all forms of suit are not punishable by monetary gain. You are
> talking a form of harassment. If anything a restraining order could be
> leveled on Mr. Clark but in no way shape or form will there be monetary
> compensation.
>
> Give us all a break and stop with this thread.
>
>
> ***** If I receive any personal replies to this E-mail I will charge the
> said sender a $500 fee for proof reading.*****
>
> *****I hold the copywrite to the above message. If said message is
replied
> too with any or all of the content without written permission from me a
> royalty fee will be charged of $5 per word.*****
>
>
> Aruyall
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message ----- >
> >
> > Here is how my lawyer put it to me. If someone sends you unsolicited
> email
> > once it is fine, but if you warn them after that email saying the
> following
> > or close to it "any further emails to this address will cost a certain
> > amount of money to proofread" it is legally binding. If the person does
> not
> > make a payment within 3 months you can take them to small claims court
and
> > charge interest on your time and work. When you warn them, and they
send
> > you another email just correct it and send it back to them. Afterwards
> > start litigation. This is an excellent way to stop hate/spam/annoying
> > emails.
> >
> >
> >
>
>
>
